About Me

Hi my name is Saehui!
I am an electrical engineer by training, data science enthusiast by hobby. I came to have a deep appreciation for the wonders of biology, and I’m always thinking of how to combine my skills to better understand the natural world.

Watson Fellow

2023 — present

I have been awarded the Watson Fellowship.

PhD Student, Stanford

2022 — present

After rotating with Professor Michaelle Mayalu working on pattern-forming synthetic circuits and rotating with Professor KC Huang to study growth dynamics of gut bacteria, I've joined the Duaskardt Group.

Undergraduate Student, Caltech EE

2018 — 2022

Graduated with a Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering. Undergraduate Researcher through the SURF program at NASA-JPL and Seoul National University Soft Robotics Lab (SRBL). I am honored to be awarded the Mabel Beckman Leadership Prize, Clark Prize, Gorden McClure Memorial Prize.
